intro: Bredemeyera rhadinocarpa, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers. The plant has a bulbous root system and produces strap-like, grassy leaves. It typically blooms in late winter to early spring, making it a notable addition to gardens in cooler climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated for its beauty and resilience.
